intro: Tiquilia tacnensis, commonly known as the Andean tiquilia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Tiquilia tacnensis is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
